Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2009 02:45PM SisterPeace wrote: Dear Kelly,  I do pray that you have good news, too.  Please let us know and I hope you do not have to wait long.
Posts.Title: I'll know tomorrow afternoon SisterPeace Lories

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2009 08:39AM SisterPeace wrote: Thank you both for your kind notes.  The results are benign.  So it seems that the particular struggle of breast cancer will not be mine at this time, except as a friend to those who bear it.  To those faced with this struggle, may you battle your way to victory, no matter what happens.  Peace be with you.  Sister.
Posts.Title: I'll know tomorrow afternoon SisterPeace Lories

Posts.Content: SisterPeace wrote: Greetings!  Today I went by myself in the rain and slush by train into Manhattan for a mammo and US.  After 6 hours I emerged from the hospital a bit dazed and almost disoriented.  By the time I left it was dark outside and I hadn't seen out a window all day.  Neither had I drank or eaten anything in all that time.  There wasn't a sign about no eating, but none of the other women were either.  This  definitely contributed to my feeling weak after such a stressful day.  I drank some OJ and ate a banana before I headed back to the train.  So, one suggestion I would have for others is to bring a snack, at least to eat when you are finished.  You don't need low blood sugar added to your difficulties.  In the meantime, I had at least 20 mammograms shots taken, a bilateral US and two core US guided biopsies, one in each breast.  I was not given Xanax, which was just as well since I was weak enough by the end of the day.  It took me an hour to get home, thankfully I got on the right train. The biopsies did not hurt.  The dr. was excellent at administering the initial numbing shots.  During the procedure I felt only pressure.  The second one was difficult for the dr.  She had to take many samples to get what she wanted.  She said that she gets results back by 1pm the following day and would call me. Thank you to Lori and Robby for encouraging me about setting the date and getting this done.  Now I'll go get those ice packs for one last round before going to sleep. Peace be with you, Sister Sister Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'll know tomorrow afternoon SisterPeace Lories

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2009 07:44PM SisterPeace wrote: Hello kaduffa, Check this link for basic definitions of birad catagories:  http://www.imaginis.com/breasthealth/acrbi.asp 4 is high enough to warrant getting that biopsy.  Although my radiologist wrote birad 3, another doctor said redo the tests and prepare for the biopsy.  My nodes are also extremely small, but a good doctor is considering a number of factors besides size.  Peace be with you,
